heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: No storm activity at the moment.  The previous storm occurred on 08 October 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 6 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (186°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 7.0°C), outside temperature (down 5.9°C), and inside temperature (down 2.9°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 7%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 518 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 8.5°C), cloud levels (up 495 m), dew point temperature (up 5.9°C), and outside temperature (up 7.1°C) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 518.4m lower than yesterday, 360.4m lower than the past week, 495.5m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 993m minimum and 2630m maximum, with an average of 1104.1m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1464.4m and 1599.5m.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; prepare for cold, chilly weather ahead. Also, dry and less humid conditions and winds will be practically absent. Showers, clouds will occasionally block sunlight, and a mix of sun and clouds. High pressure will dominate, leading to stable weather.

washing.phrase: The conditions are favourable for drying your laundry outside right now but, as always, monitor the situation for changes to the weather.
